frameDefinitions: These words refer to separating a Whole into Parts, or separating one part from another.
A Cause or Agent causes a Patient to undergo a change of phase.
An Agent alters some Material in some useful way by means of some chemical or physical Alterant.
A Destroyer (a conscious entity) or Cause (an event, or an entity involved in such an event) affects the Patient negatively so that the Patient no longer exists.
An organic item, the Patient, has undergone the natural process of rotting  and decaying with a possible expression of the Degree to which the rotting has occurred.
In this frame a Patient is in a phase brought about after a change of phase.
frameExamples: I <t>divided</t> the class into groups in alphabetical order .
Native Americans <t>dyed</t> textiles with dyes made from cedar strips.
Collect up the  <t>thawed</t> water from the freezer section.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which is separated into <fen>Parts</fen>.  It is usually the NP Object of a target verb.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned. This is most often the Object of a verb.
<fen>Part_2</fen> is the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement. First,
With causative uses of these verbs, an Agent separates or divides something.  The Agent is usually expressed as the External Argument:
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-agent that brings about the separation.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to change phase.
The <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change of phase brought about by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-<fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the change in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the Time at which the change of phase occurs.
This role identifies the place where change of phase occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a person who applies the Process to the Material.
The <fen>Alterant</fen> causes a change in the <fen>Material</fen>.
The <fen>Material</fen> is altered by the <fen>Agent</fen> in some useful way.
The point in time or period during which the treatment of the <fen>Material</fen> takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Material</fen>s are processed, often a purpose-built facility such as a tannery or water treatment plant.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the <fen>Patient</fen>'s destruction.
The entity which is destroyed by the <fen>Destroyer</fen>.
The event or entity which is responsible for the destruction of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Destroyer</fen> destroys the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Destroyer</fen> destroys the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the organic matter that has decayed.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the entity which has had its phase altered.
listRoleExamples: The directors split <fex>the company</fex> in two.
The directors split the company <fex>in two</fex>.
First, separate <fex>the yolks</fex> from the whites.
I divided the prize money among the winners <fex>that night</fex>.
You should separate the yolks from the whites <fex>over the sink</fex>.
Stu treated <fex>the lumber</fex> with magical waterproofing fairydust.
<fex>The subsequent explosions</fex> leveled most downtown office buildings.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: a few thousandths of a degree kelvin
